message:
As long as Bitcoin stays above $88k (ideally above $90k), a final bullish move is likely before a strong reversal.

Some levels I‚Äôm watching to start taking profits:

‚Ä¢ $BTC: $95k‚Äì98k
‚Ä¢ $ETH: $2,000‚Äì2,300
‚Ä¢ $SOL: $170‚Äì200
‚Ä¢ #Altcoins: 30%‚Äì100% higher on average, depending on the coin

GM! üîº

Analysis playing out. I still think $BTC can push a bit higher towards $95k‚Äì96k, and alts even higher.
Soon I‚Äôll start taking some profits.

Thank you to those who sent messages of gratitude.
I hope the analysis was helpful to many.

$BTC update

Shorting here makes no sense at all.

I‚Äôll be looking at the $94k‚Äì95k zone for potential shorts, but for now, the smart move is staying net long.

More and more altcoins pumping today. 

Higher, imo.

Happy Easter to those who celebrate!

Take care of your body, mind and soul. That‚Äôs what truly matters.
Some altcoins are already pumping today. Expecting the majority to follow soon.

$ENA update 

Many people have asked me for this, so here it is.

I consider ENA a mid-term investment. That's why I'm just holding it until August-September (subject to change / adaptation)

We can see how it has formed a massive range. Bearish trend is very oversold here, so a bounce to $0.50-0.55 keeps making sense. After that, we could see the last capitulation event I've been talking about previously. If that happens, I will buy more. If not, just hold.

GM!

The crypto market looks good for a strong bullish move.

$TON

Very clean setup, matching with the rest of the market.
$BTC trying to reclaim $85k again. That would be a very clear sign of strength and after that, we should see bullish continuation towards the $90k levels.

$BTC

Looking good for a bounce.
This dip is to be bought, imo.

$RENDER update

Strong bounce from the same main support. If it reclaims the $4.25 level, then the main target of $6-7 should be next.

$HYPE update

Not bad.

$FIL

Interesting HTF setup.
Looking good for bullish continuation/acceleration soon.

Altcoins keep showing strength, and $BTC is still trading at $83k-84k. Target for the DCB is $92k-98k...

Have a great weekend!

GM!

Altcoins showing strength and triggering some more ltf bullish confirmations.
https://x.com/CryptoCapo_/status/1910049210881495296

''$BTC reclaims $80k after Trump authorizes 90-day pause on tariffs.''

First the charts, then the news.

$BTC update

New tariffs started today, April 9, 2025: 20% on EU stuff, 34% extra on Chinese goods (54% total), and 104% on some Chinese imports.

Bitcoin price didn't react too bad to this event. In fact, it seems to be forming a double bottom formation above March's low. This could be another sign of strength for a local bottom formation.

There's also a lot of liquidity at $85k (second image). If $BTC manages to reclaim that level, then we should see a further short-term bullish move towards $92k-98k, where the bearish trend should resume.

GM!

Later I'm going to share my thoughts on what we can expect for the rest of 2025 and 2026. It‚Äôs not going to be what many want to hear, but that‚Äôs just how things are.

On the other hand, I‚Äôve been thinking a lot about how I post on X and TG.

While sharing quick updates has worked so far, the format can get messy over time. Especially when it comes to tracking my current positioning, thesis updates, invalidations, or risk adjustments.

Sometimes I‚Äôll post an analysis on a coin, enter a position, and then quickly change plans if the setup invalidates. But the nature of social media makes it easy for people to cherry-pick old posts and ignore everything that came after.

This isn‚Äôt about being ‚Äúright‚Äù all the time. I‚Äôve said it before: I don‚Äôt pretend to be perfect. The market evolves, and I adapt. That‚Äôs what trading is.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm working on changing how I structure my content going forward.

The goal is to make it easier to follow:

‚Äì Clear separation between market updates, setups, educational posts, mindset, offtopic, etc.
‚Äì Easier tracking of my current view and any changes
‚Äì Better context on why things shift and how I manage risk when they do

This should make everything more transparent and valuable. Not just for me, but for those who actually care about learning and improving in this space.

Open to suggestions. DMs on X are always welcome.

Thanks for the support as always!

Some people say my analysis are way too simple.

What you see is the final version. The clean chart. The real analysis takes hours of research, dozens of variables, and years of experience (and mistakes)

First image: ''TradingView with half the indicators on''

Second image: ''Clean version to post''

And that‚Äôs not even counting all the external tools outside of TradingView...

$RENDER update

Same setup basically, but with a double bottom formation.

Same target.

$SOL update

We didn't see that move towards $180-200, but now it has reached the target of $100. 

This is a strong support level, and as said before, a bounce from here is expected.

$ETH - Current view

Support: $1,500

Resistance zone: $2,000-2,300

Buy zone 2 (if later capitulation event): $1,000-1,100

$BTC

This would be max pain scenario, and it's the most likely imo.

#SPX futures

Reaching the 2022 high, which is a key level and could act as support.

After such a strong sell-off, a DCB in the short-term is likely, same as for crypto. That said, this looks like the beginning of something bigger for the next months.

And in case you're wondering:
I'm just holding. No active trades. Just spot bags.

Keeping 20% in stables, just in case.

In moments like this it's usually better to stay still. Most decisions made here are based on emotions, instead of rational thinking.

No changes.

We‚Äôre reaching extreme oversold and panic levels. Many are expecting a black swan tomorrow, but prices are reaching support.

I might be wrong‚Äîbut in my opinion, selling here is a mistake.

''It‚Äôs usually when things look the worst‚Ä¶ that bottoms are formed.''

$RENDER / BTC

Adding confluence for the setup against USD.
Crypto holding very well compared to the stock market. Could be another sign of strength.

#TOTAL2 (ETH + ALTS)

Retesting the same support zone.
A lot of alts look like this. Usually a local bottom structure.

GM

Crazy PA yesterday... and this is exactly why I avoid leverage most of the time.

Right now, $BTC is just deviating above and below the $84k‚Äì85k area, flip-flopping and trying to find direction.

Indicators remain bullish for the short-term, so I still think a move up is more likely. But once again, we need to see a clean reclaim of $85k to confirm that.

As long as that happens, the target would be $92k-98k, which is the next strong resistance zone.
$LINK

GM

Most people expect today to be a bearish event (Trump administration to announce global tariffs today at 4:00 PM EDT (22:00 CEST))

I see it differently. Most of the tariff news is likely already priced in. The market has been dropping for weeks.

Charts keep looking bullish for the short-term, and we‚Äôve already seen some signs of strength. Could easily turn into a buy the news kind of day.

Let's see how the market reacts!

$BTC

Bitcoin has reclaimed $84k, and is trying to reclaim the $85k level too. Sign of strength.

$RENDER update

This setup keeps looking great.

$BTC - Current view 

Bitcoin has been showing weakness since February, and in my opinion, this will likely end with a capitulation event at some point.

That said, as I‚Äôve mentioned over the last few days, indicators are flashing local bottom signals in the short term.
Sentiment is extremely negative, prices are very oversold, and most altcoins are at major support levels‚Äîforming higher lows, just like BTC.

Based on that, I believe we could see another short squeeze / bull trap soon, possibly pushing $BTC up to the $95k area, with altcoins likely outperforming.

Note: For this short-term scenario to play out, BTC must reclaim $84k, which remains a key level.

GM

$BTC has broken below $84k, which isn‚Äôt great for the short-term bullish scenario.
However, this still looks like a bear trap to me. Based on indicators and the confluence with altcoins‚Äîmost of which are holding higher lows above HTF support‚ÄîI remain bullish.

That said, I‚Äôd really like to see a strong reclaim of $84k (ideally $85k) soon to confirm strength.

Let‚Äôs see how it plays out. Have a great weekend!
$BTC plan

$BTC

Clear demand zone here. 

As long as Bitcoin stays above $84k-85k, the target remains $95k-100k.

$SOL

Looking good for a bullish move towards $180-200

GM!

LTF (Low-Timeframe) PA looking good again. We should see bullish continuation very soon.

$BTC

Looking good for a bounce.

$NEAR update

Good reaction at major HTF support. 

Target: $4.50
Altcoins LTF trend remains bullish. I just want to see more confirmations.
Not really liking this LTF PA. I would like to see a clean break above $89k for bullish continuation.
